name: Surfcomber Miami South Beach, a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.title: Chill in South Beach
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is great! Close to shops/restaurants and right on the beach. The overall vibe is chill. No loud music at the pool (like their is at the SLS next door). They have a low key bar area. Overall good staff, particularly Chris at the pool, but the outdoor bartenders were unfriendly. The rooms are small. The bathrooms are tiny. If you bring a car, prepare to wait and pay $37/day

reviews.title: A little piece of paradise without leaving the mainland
reviews.text: I highly recommend Surfcomber in Miami Beach. It's location is wonderful for leisurely walks to a myriad a fabulous restaurants and venues in South Beach. The hotel is warm and most welcoming. The staff is very attentive and work to make sure that your stay is enjoyable. The rooms are nicely appointed and the pool area is wonderful. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there and would go back there the next time I find myself in Miami.

reviews.title: Sleepless nights
reviews.text: Spent 3 nights in this place and could not sleep the entire time. There was a loud humming sound in my room that was nonstop. I told the people at front reception the first morning and they assured me that they would look into it and remedy the issue. Never heard from anyone the rest of my stay.

reviews.title: South Beach Boutique Hotel : warm atmosphere but tiny rooms ...
reviews.text: Rooms are small and tired. Bathroom is super small. These rooms sizes are what you would expect to see in Europe. Internet was slow in the room and one day that was raining we lost TV reception for a couple of hours. I am assuming they use satellite TV.

reviews.title: Great stay - close to everything.
reviews.text: Never has breakfast so can't comment. I can tell you that the prices for drinks at the pool are ridiculous, 2 mojitos = $35. Pool looked decent but never got to use it as the seats get filled quickly. The pool is too small to accommodate all the rooms the hotel has.

reviews.title: Awesome Beach Venue
reviews.text: Our large group wanted a day at the beach and ocean. We spent the entire day at this fabulous hotel. We had lounge chairs and towels by the pool as well as two covered cabanas. Maria waited on us and did a fantastic job. The food and service were great. Loved it!

reviews.title: Great service; poor timing for peace and quiet!
reviews.text: Having just stayed at the Surfcomber for the past 4 days, we cannot complement their service and personal attention any more highly. Both Nick and Chris (hopefully we've remembered their names correctly!) bent over backwards during our stay to make our trip more pleasant and those working on reception were always friendly and eager to answer questions or help in any way.

reviews.title: Nice with with a few qualms
reviews.text: Unfortunately, we unwittingly booked rooms during the Miami electronic music festival (partly hosted at the Surfcomber), which - considering we were looking for a haven of relaxation, peace & quiet on the beach etc - was not ideal timing. Having booked through a third party website that did not inform us, either of the festival or of the Surfcomber's large well-known pool-parties, we arrived and found we were unable to use the pool during our stay, and even time on the beach was accompanied by a heavy bass and beat coming either from our own hotel or (even worse) was battling in volume with one of the neighbouring properties.

reviews.title: Good location, pleasant pool area and warm friendly staff but our room was very small and, in our view, not suitable for 4 .
reviews.text: Meanwhile, the staff at the beach (K17) could not have been friendlier, more helpful, or more understanding of our frustration and this was a contributing factor to our positive feelings at the end of the trip (though we were disappointed and surprised on our one day when the pool was open that the staff at the pool were very different and not particularly friendly - to the extent that we moved back to the beach).

reviews.title: Another great stay at Surfcomber
reviews.text: We were really grateful that the hotel acknowledged the inconveniences and compensated us in part with food and beverage credit on our final bill. The only thing that would have been better would have been to have been moved to another of the Kimpton hotels away from the festival, but I assume this wasn't an option due to previous bookings.

By far the best customer service I have ever encountered at a hotel, all staff was very nice and helpful constantly greeting you with a hello even when passing by. The decor and cleanliness of the hotel was impeccable (and I am very picky) even down to the bed sheets. The location and proximity to the beach -amazing! My only concern which I refuse to account into my star rating because the hotel has no control over is the size of the rooms, we stayed in a deluxe king and between the size of the room itself and the bathroom it reminded me of a cruise ship stateroom. However I am sure other rooms are larger not to deter ANY one because this is one fantastic hotel and we will return!
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very enjoyable stay at the Surfcomber to celebrate our anniversary. We very much appreciated the front desk hospitality from Carlos and the concierge's bubbly gift to help us celebrate! Our bellman Brian was enthusiastic and professional We had a premier king ocean front room with balcony which we very much enjoyed (the paint could use just a tad refreshing) and appreciated the nightly towel and turndown surface. A request for a coffee maker was met with a Keurig and coffee pods! Maid service was very good as well.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay, would return and recommend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool side attendant Jonathan was attentive and resourceful in securing pool chairs for us. (I just wish the poolside food service attendants could be equally so....perhaps no motivation with the gratuity already figured in?) The poolside food was tasty. The beach attendants were also very attentive in securing beach chairs and umbrellas. Be aware there is major sound bleed at the pool from the thumping music at SLS next door (and we were disappointed that on our second day part of the public area was booked with a private bar mitzvah party which brought their own loud music system....just seems like private events should not infringe on the paying guests enjoying the property) The only major negative was a disaster with room service breakfast but to the management's credit the meal was comped (The wrong meal was sent up and the eventual meal which made it to the room was not particularly tasted or well presented). The bar Social has an innovative drink menu with a very talented mixologist. In a town with too much faux attitude, Surfcomber stands apart as a welcoming guest experience at a reasonable value.
reviews.title: Noisy rooms beware
A hotel I can recommend
reviews.text: There are some good but some very bad points about this hotel.
First the good.... Great location for beach nice touches like free wine around the pool and staff generally helpful.
reviews.title: Great hotel - but keep your belongings safely
Great Hotel
reviews.text: This hotel was very nice all around (as i find most Kimpton hotels to be.) I have no complains which is often the case.

reviews.title: Serviceable but a little overpriced
reviews.text: The room was nice and clean. The lounge was busy but accommodating and the food they served was excellent. The poos was busy and charming, the pool help was helpful, and the drinks were very well mixed.

reviews.title: Cute Rooms & Wine Hour at the Pool
reviews.text: The front desk help was also top notch. They checked us in early and allowed for late check out. The luggage was tagged and taken promptly and there was always someone happy to hail a cab. It was right on the beach.

reviews.title: Cannot understand the high ranking....
reviews.text: This is a good - but not excellent - hotel. I stayed 3 nights in a King room. Room was clean, but a little dated, some of the details and trimmings were showing their age.

reviews.title: Great staff, serious problems with valet and beach service
reviews.text: The bathroom especially needed a re-think. There is no shower curtain and there is no way to stop the shower flooding the bathroom every time.
